result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Yance Gabriel Mann

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference on November 15, 2022 at 10:15 am.

10:06 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Yance Gabriel Mann in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. Court calls 22FO115, 22CM38 and 21CM129. Court asks defendant if he has hired counsel. Defendant responds, not hiring counsel, has an appointment with DA on 8/16/22 to try and resolve all 3 matters. Recess to fill out waiver of right to counsel form. Recalled at 10:10 AM with same appearances. Court has waiver of right to counsel form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to counsel, finds he is competent to proceed on his own and will allow him to do so. Mann pleads NG to all counts on all cases. Court accepts plea, continues bond on all cases, sets for JT in future, if resolved with DA - contact JA for PLEAS  date.

9:23 AM Prosecuting attorney Charles James Simono in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Yance G Mann in court. Court calls 22FO115, 22CM38 and 21CM129. Court reviews file, asks about attorney status. Mann responds, two attorneys he contacted could not take his case, did talk to State on Monday. State responds, did inform State that he was not able to hire a lawyer, wanted to try to resolve matter with State, offer will go out probably today. Court - defendant can afford to hire his own, must have an attorney at next hearing and gives ramifications of appearing without an attorney, also reminds him of his right to waive his right to attorney, sets for AIA on 8/10/22 at 10:00 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 10, 2022 at 10:00 am.

9:09 AM Prosecuting attorney Alexander Paul Seifert in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Yance Gabriel Mann in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court. Court calls 21CM129, 22CM38 and 22FO115. Court asks defendant why he did not appear at his last hearing. Mann responds, stated he received a text stating his court date was cancelled then came two weeks ago and there was no court or no Judge. Court reviews file, does not see where a court date was changed. Discussion on what an attorney told him (Patrick Ross). Mann has not received the complaint on 22CM38 - given complaint in Court. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Mann understands charges and penalties, will hire counsel after making some statements as it relates to the case. Court finds he is not eligible for SPD or court appointed due to his income, gives warning of appearing again without counsel if that it what he intends to do, sets all matters for AIA on 6/15/22 at 9:30 AM. Mann would like to take care of 22FO115 today, admits to the offense. Court can proceed on that matter if the defendant wishes but informs him that it could be part of a plea bargain at a later stage and it may get dismissed. Mann will wait and not proceed on that matter today. State - bond on 22CM38 - $500.00 signature bond. Court - bond on 22CM38 - $500.00 signature bond and on 21CM129 - $500.00 cash that is already posted.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Initial appearance on June 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
